value: aava_1.0_score
description

AAVA 2.0 represents a significant structural evolution of the workflow metadata with enhanced agent modeling and improved data organization. While semantic meaning is largely preserved, the structural changes introduce moderate compatibility risks.
Core workflow concept DI_DataSpecs_Modelupdates_SN maintains identical business meaning across both versions with consistent agent purposes and task descriptions.
Agent DI_Data_Technical_Specification_SN preserves identical functional requirements and output specifications in both versions.
Agent DI_Delta_Model_Changes_SN maintains consistent data model evolution capabilities and processing logic.
Agent DI_Functional_Test_Cases_SN retains identical test case generation requirements and markdown output format.
AAVA 2.0 introduces nested object hierarchy with workFlowDetail container vs flat structure in AAVA 1.0.
Agent array restructured from nodes to workflowAgents with enhanced metadata fields.
Addition of agentId field provides unique identification not present in AAVA 1.0.
Model deployment name field added for enhanced version tracking (gpt-4.1 vs gpt-4).
Tools array replaced with toolReferences array structure for improved referential integrity.
workflowId (line 2) renamed to id (line 3) - semantic meaning preserved.
workflowName (line 3) renamed to name (line 4) - semantic meaning preserved.
nodes (line 4) renamed to workflowAgents (line 7) - improved semantic clarity.
agentName (line 11) renamed to name (line 16) - simplified naming convention.
model (line 12) renamed to modelDeploymentName (line 17) - enhanced specificity.
tools (line 13) replaced with toolReferences (line 95) - structural improvement.
Model version upgraded from gpt-4 to gpt-4.1 across all agents - indicates platform evolution.
Addition of agentId as required field introduces new constraint not present in AAVA 1.0.
AAVA 1.0 tools array contains explicit tool names while AAVA 2.0 toolReferences is empty array.
Workflow ID changed from 1594 to 2147 without clear versioning strategy documentation.
Agent naming convention inconsistency: underscores vs spaces in agent names.
Introduction of nested workFlowDetail object represents major schema evolution requiring adapter logic.
Enhanced agent metadata structure with agentId and modelDeploymentName improves traceability.
Structural changes may break existing parsers expecting flat workflow structure from AAVA 1.0.
Field renames without alias mapping could impact downstream systems and lineage tools.
Empty toolReferences arrays may indicate incomplete migration or data loss.
JSON syntax is valid and well-formed with proper nesting and data types.
All required fields present with consistent string and integer types.
Task descriptions contain complete specifications with proper formatting.
Minor formatting inconsistency in metadata requirements section with mixed delimiters.
JSON syntax is valid with proper object nesting and array structures.
Enhanced structure with agentId provides better referential integrity.
Task descriptions maintain completeness and formatting standards.
Empty toolReferences arrays may indicate incomplete data migration.
Workflow name formatting inconsistency: spaces vs underscores compared to ID.
Unclear whether empty toolReferences represents intentional removal or migration gap.
Agent name variations between versions may cause confusion in system integration.
Both versions maintain identical task descriptions ensuring functional continuity.
Model upgrade to gpt-4.1 indicates platform advancement and capability enhancement.
Structural improvements in AAVA 2.0 provide better metadata organization and extensibility.
